name: Carancas Impact
subtitle: Recent Lake Impact
description: Small meteorite impact in a dry lake bed, caused minor injuries from toxic gases

name: Whitecourt Meteorite
subtitle: Canadian Farm Impact
description: Created a crater in a farmer's field, fragments recovered

name: Innisfree Meteorite
subtitle: Lake Impact
description: Impacted a small lake, fragments recovered from bottom

name: Peekskill Meteorite
subtitle: Car-Chasing Meteor
description: Witnessed by thousands, fragments hit parked cars

name: Tagish Lake Meteorite
subtitle: Carbonaceous Chondrite
description: Fragments recovered from frozen lake, pristine condition

name: Henbury Meteorites
subtitle: Australian Impact Field
description: Field of 13 craters from iron meteorite fragments

name: Wabar Impact
subtitle: Saudi Arabian Craters
description: Two craters in the Empty Quarter desert

name: Kamil Crater
subtitle: Egyptian Impact
description: Fresh crater discovered in 2008, still visible

name: Barringer Crater
subtitle: Meteor Crater, Arizona
description: Best-preserved impact crater on Earth

name: Sikhote-Alin Meteorite
subtitle: Largest Iron Meteorite Fall
description: Created over 100 small craters, fragments still found today

name: Chelyabinsk Meteor
subtitle: Most Recent Major Impact
description: Injured 1,500 people from shockwave and shattered glass

name: Tunguska Event
subtitle: Largest Impact in Recorded History
description: Flattened 2,000 km² of forest, no crater formed (airburst)

name: Vitim Bolide
subtitle: Russian Fireball
description: Bright fireball seen across Siberia, no fragments recovered

name: Morokweng Impact
subtitle: Southern Africa's Largest Crater
description: One of the best-preserved large impact structures on Earth

name: Chesapeake Bay Impact
subtitle: Submerged Crater
description: Largest crater formed in the U.S. during the past 35 million years

name: Acraman Impact
subtitle: Australia's Largest Crater
description: Partially eroded but still visible impact structure

name: Manicouagan Impact
subtitle: Eye of Quebec
description: One of Earth's oldest known impact craters

name: Popigai Impact
subtitle: Diamond-Bearing Crater
description: Contains impact diamonds, one of the largest craters in Russia

name: Kara Impact
subtitle: Twin Crater Structure
description: Consists of two overlapping craters

name: Puchezh-Katunki Impact
subtitle: Complex Crater Structure
description: Central uplift crater with well-preserved structure

name: Sudbury Basin Impact
subtitle: World's Second Largest Crater
description: Contains world's largest nickel deposits

name: Vredefort Impact
subtitle: Largest Verified Impact Structure
description: Largest verified impact crater on Earth

name: Chicxulub Impact
subtitle: Dinosaur Extinction Event
description: Mass extinction event that ended the Cretaceous period

name: Hiawatha Glacier Impact
subtitle: Recently Discovered Under Ice
description: Hidden under Greenland ice sheet, discovered in 2018

name: Ries Impact
subtitle: Bavarian Crater
description: Well-preserved crater with suevite breccia

name: Rochechouart Impact
subtitle: French Impact Structure
description: Asymmetrical crater structure in France

name: Lappajärvi Impact
subtitle: Finnish Impact Crater
description: Well-preserved crater lake in Finland

name: Mjølnir Impact
subtitle: Submarine Crater
description: Underwater crater in the Barents Sea

name: Siljan Ring Impact
subtitle: Swedish Impact Structure
description: Large eroded impact structure in Sweden

name: Shiva Crater
subtitle: Controversial Indian Ocean Impact
description: Hypothetical massive impact structure, scientific debate ongoing

name: Woodleigh Impact
subtitle: Australian Impact Structure
description: Large buried impact structure in Western Australia

name: Gosses Bluff Impact
subtitle: Australian Crater
description: Well-preserved crater in central Australia

name: Amelia Creek Impact
subtitle: Australian Impact Structure
description: Eroded impact structure in northern Australia

name: Kelly West Impact
subtitle: Australian Impact Structure
description: Heavily eroded impact structure

name: Liverpool Impact
